thread.section_title: Finance - Crain's New York Business News Feed
thread.title: Hackers may have accessed data of 3,500 Dow Jones users
thread.title_full: Hackers may have accessed data of 3,500 Dow Jones users

author: Bloomberg News
title: Hackers may have accessed data of 3,500 Dow Jones users
text:
October 9, 2015 Updated 10/09/2015 Hackers may have accessed data of 3,500 Dow Jones users The media company is working with a cybersecurity and law firms to investigate the incident. By Bloomberg News Comments Email Print Ã— 
Dow Jones, owner of the Wall Street Journal , said payment card and contact information belonging to fewer than 3,500 current and former subscribers may have been accessed, though it found no direct evidence that any information was stolen.The media company owned by Rupert Murdoch's News Corp. notified customers Friday in a letter that it "recently determined there was unauthorized access to our systems."Dow Jones is working with law enforcement and a cybersecurity firm to investigate the incident, according to the letter signed by Dow Jones Chief Executive Officer William Lewis. He said it was likely part of a broader campaign "involving a number of other victim companies" and aimed at collecting subscribers' contact information to commit fraud."While we recognize that no company is immune to cyberattacks, we are committed to doing everything we can to protect our customers," Mr. Lewis said.
